t:intro.p: The Naive Bayes Classifier consists of the NaiveBayesMap and NaiveBayesReduce functions, which create a model from training data. You can input the model to the NaiveBayesPredict_MLE function, which uses the model to make predictions about testing data.
Note: For the Naive Bayes functions designed specifically for text classification, see Naive Bayes Text Classifier Functions.

div.dd: Specify the name of the input table column that contains the response variable, passed as text.

[Required if you omit CategoricalInputs.] Specify input table columns that contain numeric values to include in the model. This is the syntax of numeric_input_columns:
{'column_name [,...]' | '[start_column:end_column]'}[,...]
For example: 'input1','[4:21]','[25:53]','input73, input80','[25:53]'
The first column index is 0.

[Required if you omit NumericInputs.] Specify input table columns that contain categorical values to include in the model. The syntax of categorical_input_columns is the same as the syntax of numeric_input_columns.
Note: For information about columns that you must identify as categorical, see Identification of Categorical Columns.

t:intro.p: The table has the training data. Each row represents one observation.

td.div:
Response for observation.
Note: Function ignores rows that have NULL in this column.
[Column appears once for each specified numeric_input_column.] Numeric value to include in model.
[Column appears once for each specified categorical_input_column.] Categorical value to include in model.

Depends on type_nb:
type_nb
category
'NUMERIC'
NULL
'CATEGORICAL'
Category of categorical variable
Count of observations with this class, variable, and category.

Depends on type_nb:
type_nb
sum_nb
'NUMERIC'
Sum of variable values for observations with this class, variable, and category.
'CATEGORICAL'
NULL

Depends on type_nb:
type_nb
sum_sq
'NUMERIC'
Sum of square variable values for observations with this class, variable, and category.
'CATEGORICAL'
NULL

t:intro.p:
This example does the following:
Takes raw data and creates training and test sets.
Inputs the training set to the Naive Bayes Classifier function to create a model.
Inputs the model and test set to the NaiveBayesPredict_MLE function to predict the output for the test set.
Determines prediction accuracy based on the original and predicted results.

The input table of raw data, nb_input_iris, contains values for four attributes (sepal_length, sepal_width, petal_length and petal_width), grouped into three categories (setosa, versicolor and virginica).
This code divides the 150 data rows into a training data set (80%) and a testing data set (20%):
Note: Alternatively, you can do the preceding task with the Sampling or RandomSample function.
This query returns the following table:

pre.tt: SELECT * FROM nb_iris_input_train ORDER BY id;

t:intro.p: This query returns the following table:

pre.tt: SELECT * FROM nb_iris_input_test ORDER BY id;

t:intro.p: This query returns the following table:

pre.tt: SELECT * SELECT nb_iris_model ORDER BY class_nb, cnt ASC;

t:intro.p: Download a zip file of all examples and a SQL script file that creates their input tables from the download tab in the left pane.
